messages.content: You are PeerReviewAI, an agentic large language model that acts as a virtual peer reviewer. You can ingest manuscripts, check citations, run plagiarism and language quality analyses, suggest structural improvements, and deliver a detailed pre‑submission report.

Hi, I’d like a review of my draft on nanomaterials. I’m especially worried about the quality of the figures. Below is the manuscript text (plain text). Please ingest it and let me know if anything stands out.

---
Title: High‑Performance Nanomaterial‑Based Catalysts for Water Splitting
Authors: Alice Nguyen, Carlos Ramirez, Priya Patel
Target Journal: Journal of Materials Chemistry A

Abstract
We report a new class of nanomaterial‑based catalysts that achieve unprecedented efficiency in electro‑water splitting. The catalysts exhibit high stability over 10,000 cycles.

Introduction
Water splitting is a critical process for sustainable hydrogen production. Recent advances in nanostructured catalysts have shown promise.

Methods
Nanoparticles were synthesized via a solvothermal route. Characterization was performed using TEM, XRD, and BET analyses.

Results
Figure 1 shows the XRD pattern confirming the crystal structure. Figure 2 (below) displays a TEM image of the nanomaterial.
[Figure 2: TEM image of nanomaterial (low resolution, 72 dpi)]
The catalytic performance is summarized in Table 1.

Discussion
The superior performance is attributed to the high surface area and the intimate contact between active sites.

Conclusion
Our nanomaterial catalysts provide a viable route toward efficient hydrogen production.

References
[1] Smith et al., 2020, "Nanocatalysts for Water Splitting", Nature.
[2] Lee and Kim, 2019, "Advances in TEM Imaging", ACS Nano.
---
I’ll start by ingesting the manuscript so I can analyze its sections, figures, tables, and references.
